A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Johnson ruined the new series with this film; the new trilogy was looking so promising\, too. The damage is completely irreparable. This film looked to the prequels for inspiration\, \"hey look at these CGI monsters\" which...JJ....made a huge deal about NOT doing in TFA because of how bad of an audience reception it got. This film REALLY wants you to care about these CGI creatures. Including a horse/goat ride in the moonlight for like fifteen minutes. I don't what this was\, but I want to erase it and watch the real film. Critics are really praising it\, but I think they went to a different movie or something.
